Reviews.Title: Yet another fine Samsung TV in my home
Reviews.Author: C. Stone
Reviews.Content: I own a 56 inch Samsung DLP (have for some time now) and love the thing. So when it was time to get a flat screen for my bedroom (the old CRT just had to go), I went right to Samsung. My needs were 32 inches, 2 or more HDMI inputs, at least one analog composite input, at least one analog component input and a QAM tuner. I looked at a few models from other vendors (the usual suspects, Sony, Toshiba, Hitachi, etc., excluding Visio, not a chance that junk enters my home) and for the most part they were very similar in the features they offered. This model was a little better than some of the others in the same price/size range and it had some extra cool features (ability to display images from camera) and given my past experience with Samsung, I purchased this model.I mounted the TV to the wall (using a Cheetah) and cannot be more pleased. The QAM tuner found all of the cable channels that were available (although it would have been nice to just have it hunt for digital channels, I had to go back after the hunt and manually remove the analog junk). The other inputs worked as expected. The remote control is not bad but it lacks a button to turn Closed Captions on/off (you need to navigate the menus to turn on/off, what a hassle). Picture quality is great, and the sound is what you expect for built in speakers (not great, but sufficient)All of that said, I give this baby two thumbs up...

Reviews.Title: Outstanding Picture Quality; Very Good Value
Reviews.Author: Jack Gadzala "Jack"
Reviews.Content: One month of viewing has reinforced my initial experience that this Samsung LN32C530 32-Inch 1080p is an outstanding LCD HDTV.  After researching Consumer Reports and several online ratings sites, the choice came down to the LG 32LH30 32-Inch 1080p and a comparable Vizio (also 32" 1080p).  Both the other two were less expensive, but the research suggested that the Samsung quality and features would be worth it.  It was correct.  The picture quality is outstanding, viewing the TV off-angle only results in a minimal brightness reduction (less than I've typically noticed in other LCDs).  Sound is fine (I use the TV speakers - not a home theater system for this TV).  Satisfaction is 100%.

Reviews.Title: Looking for a great cheap 32inch HD, THIS is the one to get!
Reviews.Author: Colin V. G. Quinsland
Reviews.Content: I got this TV a little over a month ago, and have not once regretted the purchase. Before this TV I had a 32 inch Sony KDL-V32XBR1 for over 5 years, and finally decided now was going to be the time to get my own as I am moving out of my house. I did some research and found that Samsung was definitely in the lead in terms of quality and price, and finally settled on this model. I got it for 499 on sale at Best Buy, and the difference was incredible! This monitor is BEAUTIFUL, especially for 500 bucks! You might want to do a little tweaking with the color settings, but it usually does a very good job looking great without any help from you. I have HD Cable, a Xbox 360 hooked up via Component, and a PS3 hooked up with HDMI. The TV automatically senses which ports are active and only switches between the ones that have an incoming signal going to them, which is really convenient. It also has a power setting which defaults to on which will detect the ambient light and lower the back-lighting on the monitor to save power. I personally found that it lowered the light too much, as I like my movies bright and colorful, so I ended up turning it off, which I would recommend to anyone who doesn't mind spending a little extra power on their picture.IMPORTANT NOTE: I originally had a hard time with ghosting showing up on bluray like another reviewer, but it just didn't make sense and unlike the other reviewer, after a little research I found that Digital Noise Reduction filters cause all the ghosting with HDTV's these days, so once I turned that off in the TV's menu, everything was back to being incredibly sharp and quick! Just make sure to turn that off when gaming or watching High Def movies, and you will NEVER look back on getting this TV. It has an incredible amount of BANG for the buck.

Reviews.Title: Nothing but problems with this one...
Reviews.Author: A. Garcia
Reviews.Content: I was very excited about this purchase, the price point is great and it is a Samsung. The first shipment got here quickly and I was happy to set it up. As soon as I turned on my PS3 I noticed the left speaker (they are hidden by the way, which looks great!) would go in and out. I tried many different input devices and the sound problem continued so I knew it was the TV.I sent it back (Amazon was great by the way) and got a replacement... no sound issues. I thought it was a simple mistake and I was unfortunate and happily set up the new one. Later that night I was watching a BD and noticed the screen would darken and lighten about every ten seconds, over and over again. It continued to do this even as I turned the movie off and switched over to the X360. Called Samsung customer support and they basically told me I needed service, the nice lady then recommended (since it was only a day old and all) I simply return it to the place of purchase for a new one. Well after two tries and both being lemons right out of the box, I can't justify trying again. It's a shame because the picture quality is great, exactly what you would expect from a Samsung and it was really hard for me to have to move on for another brand. I still plan on purchasing a Samsung, but I won't lie and say this experience has made me very hesitant.Keep in mind, this is a very new model. I cannot recommend purchase of this set right now, but I'm sure in the future it will get a lot stronger. Furthermore, I could simply be extremely unlucky to get two lemons in a row.

Reviews.Title: The Samsung LN32C530 TV has an important advantage
Reviews.Author: William E. Bender "TIVO addict"
Reviews.Content: I recently purchased the Samsung LN32C530 TV and I love it. We installed it in the bedroom, and it has a feature that is a big advantage for us: the "timer on" to wake us in the morning.  We use it as our alarm clock to awaken us.  Almost all TVs have a "timer off" feature or a "sleep timer", but Samsung is one of the few TV manufacturers who offer the "timer on" advantage.Also, I become amused by a review that complains that he had to put 4 screws into 4 screw holes to install the base.  Is he joking?  We installed the base and had it operational in about 10 minutes with no problems, and I am a senior citizen.This is my 2nd Samsung TV purchase this year, and they offer a superior picture at minimal price.Samsung LN32C530 32-Inch 1080p 60 Hz LCD HDTV (Black)

Reviews.Title: Very Pleased with the Samsung 530
Reviews.Author: Malinda R
Reviews.Content: Third time's the charm. And am I glad I found this Samsung! I must admit purchasing at a local store but would have happily bought it from Amazon and saved money.Here's the deal; I wanted a 32" HDTV for a spare bedroom in the 500 dollar range. First went with the Sony 32EX400. Now this may sound like a crazy reason for going with the Sony but I chose it because I discovered with my Dish Network remote control if you find the correct TV code, then the (*) asterisk button on lower left of the Dish's remote will activate the Sony's Sleep Timer. Hooked up the Sony to the HDMI from the Dish Receiver and there was a glitch where it says it cannot locate any HDMI device. Screen is black unless I unplug the HDMI then put back in. More issues with that Sony but long story short I took it back. The local store had received a new shipment of that Sony (and with different serial number series) so I risked trying the same model. Hooked the second one up and still had the HDMI issue. I wanted to make sure it wasn't on my end so I hooked up an HDTV from another bedroom: no problem, so I knew the Sony was going back and I'd go with a different brand. Did my online homework and this Samsung 530 seemed to fit the bill. Wow! What a difference between the Sony and this Samsung! I haven't even touched the Samsung to adjust contrast or color. The Sony was dim right out of the box on both sets I tried.Love the remote control on this Samsung. Nice big buttons and color coding is a plus for a bedroom TV. And it has a dedicated "SLEEP" timer button on the remote. No hunting through a menu. I've included a pic in the photo area.Tip for Dish Network users: If you program the Dish's remote control "TV" mode button to code 858, it will work like the Sony, allowing the (*) asterisk button to activate the "Sleep Timer". No more switching remotes to set the timer.I would recommend this set to anyone looking in this price range.

Reviews.Title: Problem right from startup
Reviews.Author: Daniel Burgio
Reviews.Content: It took a butt load of time and finagling to get the screws for the stand in.  Then, when I started the tv, I heard the sound flutter in the start-up jingle it plays.  I thought "great, a problem from the get-go.  Maybe it will go away..."  Well, it didn't.  The sound kept fluttering right until my last day with it, which would be the second.  I had to ship it back to Samsung to get it repaired (instead of having someone come out...)  Now I'm waiting for it to come back, which could be a month.  I already had to wait a week to get it, and then quite a while during the setup because of the screw problem, and now I have to wait for it to come back.  I paid quite a bit, albeit it with an amazon store card, to have it close to immediately.  Instead I had to go through the trouble of shipping the stupid thing away and now am waiting for who knows how long...  I realize that these things happen with electronics, but I have to give this current review based on what I got and will be updating it based on whatever I get back.*Update*I sent the tv in, waited a loooong time for them to repair it (they said they were waiting for a part to come in), and now that I have it back, I'm angrier than before.  The problem was kind-of-repaired.  The sound only flutters some of the time instead of always.  I wasn't entirely convinced that I was truly hearing it until a few minutes ago when the problem reared its ugly head briefly.  Now I'm not so sure I'm going to keep this piece of garbage.*Update...again*I sent the tv in a second time and got it back with the same problem.  I was told that there wasn't an issue with the tv either time I sent it for repairs (even though I was told the first time that the technicians were waiting for a part).  Now they want it back a third time so they can find what's wrong with it...  While I'm completely and utterly sure they will find what's wrong with it the third time, I'll be sending it back.  I'll probably be investing in a Sony or Panasonic in the future.*Final Update (I promise.)*I had to return it yesterday but before that, I took it to a friends house to see if it was just getting interference from the outlets in my apartment.  Unfortunately, the sound still acted up, albeit rarely.  It's a shame because I really did like this tv and didn't want to return it, but I just couldn't trust that the Samsung techs would fix it...  I want to get another Samsung, but I know that if it acts up, I'll have to put up with a lot of crap from customer service.  On a final note, I'm calling them tonight to cancel the repair request I made and they are going to feel my wrath... or at least hear it.

Reviews.Title: A GREAT TV FOR THE PRICE
Reviews.Author: Mark G. Johnson "mj"
Reviews.Content: Love this tv. This tv is so new that there is not much info out there on it. I did find that it is 60,000:1 contrast with the new 4.0 energy savings setup. Turned it on and the picture was as you would find on most Samsung LCD's. Very clear, bright and detailed. I also have a 46", 550 series and the sound from this 32" 530 series is some what better.The one issue maybe that this is so new to the market that techs from Samsung really don't have any helpful info. to help you with questions. But when I called they said that this should change around the first of April 2010. All in all I'am very pleased with this tv so far.

Reviews.Title: Some Pros and Cons
Reviews.Author: Prone
Reviews.Content: Pros:1. Price - Great value considering its a Samsung brand2. 1080p - Full HD Capability3. 32 inch - Reasonable size for a bedroom4. USB outlet - A nice perk to hook up your external HD to watch movies/pictures.5. Thickness - Not as thick as other brands such as LG & Visio.Cons:1. Start Up time - There is a 5-10 second delay from pressing the power button to the TV to actually power on. (This is annoying)2. Read time of HDD - There is a 10-20 second delay for the USB slot to detect the external hard drive. (This is also annoying)3. Darkening of screen - There are random flashes when the screen darkens for no reason whatsoever; I'm not sure if there is the TV's fault or the poor signal from the cable company.4. 60HZ refresh rate - I was hoping that this TV would have a 120 HZ refresh rate but there is a big jump of 100/200 dollars extra to get it included.Conclusion:The Pros outweigh the Cons so I would recommend this purchase if you have a strict budget of 500 dollars and want a 1080 p HDTV display.

Reviews.Title: Working great and I like it
Reviews.Author: Pen Name
Reviews.Content: Purchased the LN32C530 for the living room a couple days ago and am loving it.Have not had any problems / noticed anything I don't like.Hooked up an Mac Mini to the HDMI port. For the audio from the computer to the tv, you just connect  a 1/8" (3.5mm) Stereo Male to 1/8" (3.5mm) Stereo Male cable between the computer and TV. (The tv doesn't have an digital/toslink audio out port).Loving it so far.6-14-10 Update:One thing I don't like is once a month or so, using the remote I accidentally put the tv into shop/store mode.Wish there was a way to figure out what I was pressing that was doing it. I think it has to do with my holding down the volume button for long periods for one thing.

Reviews.Title: Great TV
Reviews.Author: MJ
Reviews.Content: This TV has one of the best picture in the 32 inch category. The sound from the speakers is pretty good actually and I mostly hear it at 10 (100 being highest). I have it connected with a Directv SD box and after messing with the settings, the picture looks great for being SD. High Def. channels of course look excellent.My setting for SD are:Mode: StandardBacklight: 8Contrast: 90Bright: 40Sharp: 30color: 45Tint : G46/R54Black tone: DarkDynamic Contrast: MediumGamma +1White balance: G-offset 15G-Gain 15Edge Enhancement : OnDigital Noise: Either High or Offany settings not listed where not changed. Hope this helps.

Reviews.Title: Second Samsung LCD
Reviews.Author: R. Decoux "flkid"
Reviews.Content: I've had my 32 inch Samsung for over 30 days now so am finally comfortable offering my opinion on the product (vs a review after only one week of ownership). This is my second Samsung LCD (purchased a 40" three years ago) and overall, I'm very satisfied with Samsung's quality, features and workmanship. For a second TV to have in the bedroom, I am very satisfied with the picture and sound quality, espacially after being connected to a HD cable box--you can't get any clearer of a picture than a Samsung! If there were one thing (and the only one I can think of) to criticize on this product it would be the ability to get the same viewing quality from side angles like my 40" set offers (and I'm not sure if that diminishes as the TV gets smaller). If you are sitting in front of the TV your picture quality is 120%++ but when you try and view the TV from more than a 45 degree angle the picture quality is not as good as it is when viewing directly in front of the set. The one good thing is that the TV easily swivels to various angles with ease and this isn't a problem as long as you don't have the TV mounted flat against the wall.  Shipping was faster than expected and the only problem was that FEDEX left the TV leaning against the front door (since it's value was under $500) which is VERY scarey and if it was earlier in the day I might not have been so lucky!!!

Reviews.Title: Samsung 32"  LN32C530
Reviews.Author: B. J. Galvin "Spirits & angels"
Reviews.Content: I have had many Samsung electronic items and once again, Samsung has outdone themselves!!!!  What a terrific TV for the money.  The picture is is outstanding, the sound is terrific and the television itself is superb value -- it exceeds my expectations.  For those who had had difficulties [regarding their reviews herein] I cannot imagine what happened.  We are dutifully grateful to Samsung for yet another outstanding product.  Thank you.

Reviews.Title: CLASS ACTION SUIT ON THIS TV
Reviews.Author: PinkRabbit "deb6071"
Reviews.Content: I purchased this TV in 2010 based on the excellent reviews.  About 6 months ago it started turning itself off and then turning itself back on within 5 minutes.  Over the past few months the situation has worsened and last night it turned itself off and on a total of 12 times in just under 6 minutes.  In researching this problem, I found that back in 2010 Samsung had a class action suit brought against them because of this issue.  It has something to do with blown capacitors in the power supply.  If your TV was manufactured from 2006- 2008, you were eligible to get the TV fixed for free. After 2008, you were out of luck.  My TV was manufactured in 2010.  Samsung customer service is awful.  You get hung up on and disconnected. It is clear that they continued to manufacturer these TVs knowing there was a defect.  Do yourself a favor and DONT TAKE THE CHANCE.  Get yourself something else.  Just not this TV.  Will NEVER get another Samsung.

Reviews.Title: If it hasn't broken yet, it will
Reviews.Author: Run and Dance "RunandDance"
Reviews.Content: We purchased this model LCD TV set in May of 2010.  The sticker on the back says it was manufactured April 2010.  After about a year the TV kept turning itself off and then back on again.  This happened once or twice a night, so we ignored it.  After all, it still worked.  Then this last week it kept turning off and on again about 5 to 10 times a night and then last weekend, it wouldn't turn on at all.  It kept trying and played half the chime that it plays when it turns on normally and just kept cycling.  Some internet research revealed that this is a known problem with Samsung TVs.  Some guy filed a class action lawsuit back in 2010 and Samsung was made to replace the defective capacitors in the power supply.  However, they continued to produce the defective TVs which ARE NOT covered by this lawsuit.  Samsung even has a website dedicated to the settlement to let you know you are SOL.  [...] So, we would be out of luck except we used a Visa card which doubles the one year warranty.  It lasted about 20 months total.  Other than it not being reliable, it had a great picture while it lasted.  I'd give zero stars if that were possible.  Don't buy Samsung!!

Reviews.Title: Nice entry HD TV
Reviews.Author: Nicole Mejias
Reviews.Content: I chose this TV as my first HD TV to have, and it was an excellent choice. You do have to toggle with some factory settings to get it to work as desired, but I haven't encountered any problems from one month of having the unit. Excellent sound, picture, and the ability to connect to your PC, camera and USB is pretty nice. It's an excellent entry HD TV, if you haven't had one before.

Reviews.Title: Very Pleased
Reviews.Author: Donny
Reviews.Content: The Samsung TV arrived sooner than expected from Amazon.  It was easy to set up and worked perfectly.  Great picture and sound quality, automatically picked up available channels and then deleted the channeles that were scrambled (nice feature).  After purchasing the TV we bought a second one for another room.  I highly recommend this product to others.

Reviews.Title: Samsung has done it again
Reviews.Author: A. Goel "4ML"
Reviews.Content: Fanstastic 1080p HDTV - Video is great, audio is enough for a bedroom. Setting it up is easy, and it looks great once you set up the contrast and colors (both are set on high settings). The only thing I don't like is having the red led light always turned on unless you manually switch it off. That can be annoying for some people.

Reviews.Title: I like it
Reviews.Author: Darren Dunham
Reviews.Content: About 6 years ago, I was shopping for my last TV.  At the time, I was very concerned with how it would fit in the location I needed.  I didn't have much space and was really worried about how the speakers would add to the size.  Many sets had side-mounted speakers and I got one with under-mounted speakers.  There was a big difference in quality as well.I look around now, and all the sets have tiny bezels with basically invisible speakers and the overall quality is much better.  What's left to pick?In my case, I still have a lot of non-HDMI equipment.  At the lower end, sets have more and more HDMI and less other connections.  Many sets only have one composite and one component input.This Samsung was pretty well rated, and it had 2 component and 2 composite inputs (but see below for more on that).  I think that I paid about $50 or $75 more than another model that should have been as good, but I save the hassle of needing to change plugs or buying extra equipment.  Good deal for me.The image is sharp and clear.  The ATSC tuner is able to bring in more channels than my 6-year-old viewsonic could.  Unfortunately, it doesn't have any type of "channel add" capability.  So when you rescan you potentially lose marginal stations.  Too bad, but that's apparently the norm at this end of the pricing.  Built-in audio is entirely adequate for my ears.Oddities:  While the specs on this unit are 2 composite and 2 component inputs, it's not obvious that you can't hook them all up at the same time.  One set of plugs on the unit is shared for both a composite and component input.  So you can either have 2 composite/1 component or 1 composite/2 component simultaneously, not all four.  I didn't expect that.Bezel is glossy black and the unit comes with a cleaning cloth for it.  It really picks up dust quickly.  The matte finish of my older unit didn't do that nearly as fast.Overall, very happy.

Reviews.Title: defect
Reviews.Author: Esther Almodovar
Reviews.Content: damn thing keeps shutting itself on and off  sometimes I have to unplug it just so I can turn it off  very annoying I would never buy another Samsung just for that reason

Reviews.Title: Can not play audio devices through the speakers.
Reviews.Author: Ken Brooklyn
Reviews.Content: I've owned this set for almost three years.  Picture and sound is all great, and there have been no defects.BUT BE WARNED:If you ever want to play your ipod or other audio through the speakers it will not play.  The speakers cut off unless there is also video being sent at the same time.  This seems intentional and is a huge disappointment.Pfft. I've been able to do this on every other TV I have owned. Annoying!

Reviews.Title: Its OK
Reviews.Author: Just Some Guy "Cas"
Reviews.Content: I bought this for my mother, hear complaints are as follows:1. It is too dark (which some others complained of as well);2. It takes too long to load up;3. And, as with all Samsung LCDs, the sound isn't great.However, the picture/detail is great and I wouldn't say its bad. For some reason, the 46 and 52 inch LCDs are much better than their smaller counterparts. As such, I recommend anyone thinking of purchasing this saves their money for one of these larger models.

Reviews.Title: Great TV!
Reviews.Author: Chicago nancy
Reviews.Content: I've had this Tv for almost 3 months now. It replaced a very old 19". I chose this size & brand based on my sisters advise. I had been considering a larger- 38 - 40"- but this size is perfect. I am viewing from about 8ft away & it's so much bigger & clearer than the old set. And now I can see the whole picture, unlike the old set that chopped off the sides or made the picture tiny to fit the elongated form. My sister strongly recommended Samsung due to her past experience with the brand. It arrived as expected from Amazon. My sister put it all together, without difficulty. She did need a helper to support the TV while attatching the base. I had bought the recommended HD cord, but it was unnecessary as I don't have HD cable. I use this only as a TV (& an occassional netflix movie.) I was really concerned about all the comments about these new TV's sound being so terrible. I am not connected to any sound system with it & the sound is great. There are uncountable adjustments for the picture & sound- Actually more than I knew what to do with. But each item has a little explaination on screen as you go through them all. I really love the timer that shuts it off at your selected time.Then I can fall asleep & it will turn off to save some energy. (You can even set it to turn on like an alarm!) I recommend this TV to anyone who is looking for a new set & just want to watch TV/ cable programs.

Reviews.Title: Samsung HD TV
Reviews.Author: Alley Oop
Reviews.Content: Very good colors and sharp pictures..Easy to set up and use.This is my 2nd Samsung LED TV. The sound quality could be better.

Reviews.Title: Great TV
Reviews.Author: Connie "Nurse"
Reviews.Content: I was very happy to save some money on my TV.  It came from the Amazon Warehouse and was in mint condition.  The picture quality is excellent.  The speed of the delivery was also a pleasant surprise.  It only took a few days and it was on my doorstep.

Reviews.Title: Samsung
Reviews.Author: Teresita Iglesias "The Uni student"
Reviews.Content: Very good value for money and crisp image.  Sound could be better but perfect for the room where is fitted

Reviews.Title: Great HDTV
Reviews.Author: S. Bridges
Reviews.Content: Purchased this 32" LCD to replace a 19" TV in our home office. It is hooked up to our Dish TV box via 100 feet of component cable. Also hooked up to an antenna and sometimes to a laptop. All sources produce perfect pictures. As with all flat screen of this size, the audio is only good, not great, but adequate. Seemed the best of those I heard in the local stores. I would run separate speakers if the set had an output that was volume controlled, why they don't include an earphone jack is strange. We have 3 other Samsung HDTVs, 26" and 42" LCDs plus and an older 56" DLP. All work great. I highly recommend this HDTV.

Reviews.Title: Top Notch
Reviews.Author: H. Leavitt
Reviews.Content: Just the right size for our study, the Samsung 32" is a winner all around.  The picture is sharp and clear, colors are great, and the sound is fine.  It is also very light.  The only thing I'd change is having the swivel base with more range of motion.

Reviews.Title: Excellent Style, poor performance.
Reviews.Author: Jayson Allyson "Spaztik"
Reviews.Content: Let me just say that I was really excited to get this TV. So excited that I simply forgot to check the pixel response time before I went to purchase it. When I hooked my PS3 up to this TV via HDMI, I noticed horrible ghosting. This is not a fast display. If you're going to be doing any type of gaming on this display, I would go with something else. Then, after I saw how bad the ghosting and overdrive was, I immediately went online to try to find out what the response time was and what do you know... there's no response time listed for this model on ANY website. Even the websites that list response time put "N/A" in that section. Do yourself a favor and make sure you know the response time of your TV before you buy it. If it doesn't list a response time, you're probably in for trouble.I also purchased the new 26" UN26C4000 and that screen also had the same horrible ghosting... again, no response time listed anywhere that I could find.In conclusion, I was not happy with the performance of this TV. If you want to go ahead and order it anyway, that's your call, but I'm just putting the warning out that if you don't like ghosting or overdrive, do not buy this. You'll be disappointed. Note: I also saw a lot of ghosting in movies too.By the way, I know how to use the display settings on my PS3, so don't tell me that I have an issue with the PS3. I also have a 40" Samsung that is 1080p and I have no issues with ghosting or anything.

Reviews.Title: This is great!
Reviews.Author: M. Chang
Reviews.Content: Delivery was so quick that it just took two days after ordering. It was easy to combine all components together and to set up TVs.If you consider LCD TVs having brand power, performance, and reliability, I can say that buy this product. Fantastic!The product shows all of cutting-edge-technologies which LCD TV can show us. The design and curvature are so great and nothing could be drawful. The weight is only 2/3 of other TVs. Picture quality is amazing!

Reviews.Title: nice TV with small problems
Reviews.Author: EmBee
Reviews.Content: The TV was shipped to me very quick. The package was tight n nice. It's easy to assemble by myself. The TV was even bigger/nicer than I imagined.However, the power supply wire couldn't fit the TV set correctly, really bad connection. we had to touch it every 2 days to fix the power. So I wrote to Amazon asking for an exchange of the wire. I didn't want to replace the whole TV set, too much trouble to ship the TV back. They said the best way is to contact Samsung to solve the problem. I did so, multiple times. But Samsung service had never replied to me. I then wrote to Amazon and told them maybe the service people @ Samsung were all dead... It was a Friday and I didn't check my email over the weekend.On Monday my bf texted me at work asking why another TV arrived to the house. Amazon got me an replacement for my TV within no time. All I wanted was the wire. I then exchanged the wire and sent the new TV( with amazon return label) to UPS.Now problems solved. I'm not sure how much the TV costs on black Friday sale though.

Reviews.Title: Samsung ln32c530 review
Reviews.Author: Sandman
Reviews.Content: I am very satisfied with Sansung HD LCD TV. I have had for few weeks. UPS lost first TV I ordered so it took two extra weeeks to get my TV. I got 2nd TV in couple days after I emailed Amazon that unit was never delivered.

Reviews.Title: Me encanta
Reviews.Author: Francisca Vazquez
Reviews.Content: Desde que vi esta TV me gusto, pero no estaba segura sobre que tamaño ordenar y ahora estoy segura que elegí el tamaño apropiado para mi recamara. Se ve muy clara la imagen, el sonido es apropiado, la estoy disfrutando mucho.

Reviews.Title: Buyer beware
Reviews.Author: DE
Reviews.Content: Great picture and no sound, this was our experience with this HDTV.  Buyer beware on the quality control on this model.  Our advice is to try another model.

Reviews.Title: at first i wasnt sure but now...
Reviews.Author: James Williams
Reviews.Content: I don't have this model but so what.first i got an LE 32 hd it sucked. The samsung is built well, its heavy and is fixed to a solid round chunk of clear plastic.I know sony is not as strong as my samsung model. can not be knocked over,very srong. it has a sharp look everything is good but one thing with my model if you look at it off angle the picture gets brighter i dont know why. my maw has a sony 32 hd and it does not get as bright off angle. other then that this tv is awsome. its the 2nd 32 hd we have. my 32 is about 5 feet from my face and it is not to big. i wanna get one for my pc makeing it 3 hd 32's we will have and two of them are samsung. maybe it getting brighter of angle has something to do with it being an LED. The model on this page is LCD. i recommend samsung 32. sorry about the spelling.
